Biography of Shi Minglong, Monk of Xiu Feng An on Mount Yang in Northern Zhili. Shi Minglong, a native of the Yao family of Suqian, Huaibei, was also known as Da Guang.
His secular name was Dongyang.
He once served as a student in the local school.
He always enjoyed cultivating and studying Buddhist scriptures.
For twenty years, he did not ask his family about their livelihood.ğŸ”½In the first year of the Longqing era,
he became a layman.
He traveled north to visit famous and prosperous monasteries and sought out virtuous elders.
He stayed in Qingyuan for three cold and hot seasons.
He went up Mount Yin and shaved his head and received full ordination from Great Light Chan Master at Fahua Temple.
He then lived at Xiu Feng An on Mount Yang.
His reputation and virtue rose.
He wore a single coarse robe, neither a robe nor a jacket, and no shoes or socks.
The nobles and wealthy people made many offerings, but he did not pay attention to them. He set a date of 72 days and 1,000 days.
He personally gave Dharma talks and expounded the fundamental principles of the three teachings.
At that time, Wang, the magistrate of Xiongningshan, was ordered to serve as a border official.
On his way out of the imperial tombs, he visited Fahua Temple in the prefecture.
Hearing of the master's lofty virtue, he went to see him.
A novice monk came to meet him.
He saw the master's robe was open, not covering anything, yet he was not affected by the cold.
Wang and the prefect stepped aside to pay respects to him.
They took him into the cave.
Sitting on a stone bench, they talked with him.
The master briefly mentioned the meaning of the transmission from the west.
The prefect was refreshed and believed in him.
Wang asked if it could be made a permanent residence after 1,000 days.
He said, No permanence, no dwelling.
The next day, he took leave and returned.
More than 15 days later, on the first day of spring,
Yangshan emitted five-colored light.
Another seven days later, on New Year's Eve, he gathered the assembly and said:
On the first day of the first month of the new year, I will depart.
Those of you who know letters should use your ears to hear the sutras.
Those who do not know letters should use their minds to contemplate the Buddha.
Strive for meditation, wisdom, and the universal mind of saving beings.
This is precisely the Buddha, do not seek him elsewhere.
You should strive for this.
At midnight on New Year's Eve, he ordered his disciples to look at the stars in the middle of the sky and said:
Is it midnight?
They said, It is midnight.
The master said:
Not yet.
At noon, I will depart.
On New Year's Day, Mount Yang emitted five-colored light again, just as before.
At noon, the master took leave of the assembly and passed away.
Seven days later, when his body was cremated, it emitted light again, just as before.
The great assembly and the high officials looked at the light and bowed to the master, saying:
Is it the Buddha? Is it the Buddha?
We wish that this light will universally illuminate the lower realms.
Then, the relics appeared.
The prefectural government built a stupa to enshrine them.
Wang Gong wrote an inscription for him.
It was awarded on the first day of the first month of the Wanli era.
